reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5634-GY 15 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Brand Style Single-Pole, AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, Gray
reviews.text: All in all, I can't complain too much. It's a perfectly cromulent solution for putting two switches into a single gang box (or one slot of a two-gang box). It does have removable tabs on both sides, and not every similar product does. This allows you to wire up two lights that are on two different circuits without issue - in my case an outdoor light and an outdoor outlet that are both switched from inside the house. It solves the problem fine and it's from a reputable brand so I'm confident that it will last. It's got some very minor issues. It is a bit bulky. It's not as deep as a GFCI receptacle for example, but it is thicker than a normal switch and this may impact fitment in older boxes. This is why I only gave four stars for ease of installation. The added girth, plus the fact that you're installing two pairs of wires into it means that things are going to get pretty cramped in an older box. The overall feel during operation just doesn't feel as nice as a typical decora switch, and it's hard to describe why. The click sound that it makes feels hollow and it has quite a bit of resistance when being toggled. It just feels a bit cheap. Which is a shame because it's not cheap at all - it's more expensive than the equivalent product with the old toggle style switches would be and it should feel similarly premium. Ultimately there just aren't many solutions on the market for single-gang multi switches in a decora style, especially in unusual colors. If that's what you need, it's probably the best out there. I'm certainly going to trust Leviton more than the unpronounceable gibberish brands that infect Amazon - at least I can be confident that this has proper UL certification and is up to code. For that reason alone, I recommend this over any product that isn't from a reputable major brand.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.title: Perfectly functional, but doesn't feel as nice as the single-switch versions

reviews.text: We had some remodeling done on our bathroom. The bathroom originally had a separate switch for the fan and light, but the electrician, for whatever reason combined and placed them on one switch. This combination switch allowed for the one switch look, but also have dual functionality of operating each individually. Very easy to install as well.

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5634-GY 15 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Brand Style Single-Pole, AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, Gray
reviews.text: I used this to split up the lighting in a bath room. So the overhead chandelier light now goes to the top toggle and the vanity lights go to the bottom. I like that another gang did not have to be added to do this, since there was very limited room to add additional switches. The gray color is a very natural gray. The Leviton gray matches the Lutron gray very well, as long as both are glossy. I installed Lutron covers and dimmers with the Leviton switches and outlets (much cheaper). However, the GFCI I have is not the glossy gray and is a flat textured gray, so it does not match as well. I'm sharing the color observation, as I searched online and compared in stores to make sure the mixed brands would look good together. Not all other manufacturer grays match.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2018
reviews.title: Leviton gray matches Lutron gray
